purpose: Geospatial utility functions for calculating distances between geographic coordinates and generating Google Maps URLs. Uses the Haversine formula for accurate distance calculations on Earth's surface.
dependencies: Geo type from akeyless-types-commons - Geographic coordinate interface with lat and lng properties

exports.name: get_distance_in_meters_between_geo_points
exports.description: Calculates the great-circle distance between two geographic points using the Haversine formula.

parameters.name: location1
parameters.description: First location with lat (latitude) and lng (longitude) properties

parameters.name: location2
parameters.description: Second location with lat and lng properties

behavior: Uses Haversine formula for calculating distances on a sphere
Assumes Earth's radius of 6,371,000 meters (6,371 km)
Converts degrees to radians for trigonometric calculations
Formula accounts for Earth's curvature for accurate results

exports.name: get_location_url
exports.description: Generates a Google Maps URL for viewing a location.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location with lat and lng properties

behavior: Creates a Google Maps link that opens the location when clicked
Uses Google Maps query parameter format
Coordinates are included as comma-separated values

context: Distance Calculations - Determining proximity between vehicles, users, or locations
Location Sharing - Generating shareable map links for locations
Geofencing - Checking if locations are within certain distances
Route Planning - Calculating distances for route optimization
best_practices: Use for distances up to ~1000 km for best accuracy
For UI display, consider formatting meters to kilometers for readability
Cache distance calculations when possible for performance
Use get_location_url for generating shareable location links in emails/SMS
